x10.matrix.comm

Class ArrayRemoteCopy

  • x10.matrix.comm.ArrayRemoteCopy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayBcast, ArrayGather, ArrayRcast, ArrayReduce, ArrayScatter

    public class ArrayRemoteCopy
    This class supports inter-place communication for data arrays which are defined in PlaceLocalHandle.

    To enable MPI communication, add "-define MPI_COMMU -cxx-prearg -DMPI_COMMU" in x10c++ build command, when you include commu package in your application source code, or link to the proper GML library (native_mpi version).

    For more information on how to build different backends and runtime, run command "make help" at the root directory of GML library.

      • copy

        public static void copy(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> src,
        x10.lang.Int srcOff,
        x10.lang.PlaceLocalHandle<x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double>> dstplh,
        x10.lang.Int dstpid,
        x10.lang.Int dstOff,
        x10.lang.Int dataCnt)
        Declaration: copy(src:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},srcOff:x10.lang.Int,dstplh:x10.lang.PlaceLocalHandle[x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1, self.zeroBased==true, self.rect==true, self.rail==true}],dstpid:x10.lang.Int,dstOff:x10.lang.Int,dataCnt:x10.lang.Int): void.
        Copy multiple columns from source array data at here to the specified remote
place in DistArray of dense matrix.
        

        Parameters:
        src - -- the source array
        srcOff - -- starting column in in source matrix
        dstplh - -- target in PlaceLocalHandle
        dstpid - -- the place id of target in DistArray.
        dstOff - -- starting column offset in target matrix at destination place
        dataCnt - -- count of columns to be copied from source dense matrix

        public static void copy(x10.lang.PlaceLocalHandle<x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double>> srcplh,
        x10.lang.Int srcpid,
        x10.lang.Int srcOff,
        x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> dst,

        x10.lang.Int dataCnt)
        

        Declaration: copy(srcplh:x10.lang.PlaceLocalHandle[x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1, self.zeroBased==true, self.rect==true, self.rail==true}],srcpid:x10.lang.Int,srcOff:x10.lang.Int,dst:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},dstOff:x10.lang.Int,dataCnt:x10.lang.Int): void.
        Copy data array from in the specified place at
here to target
        

        Parameters:
        srcplh - -- source data array in PlaceLocalHandle
        srcpid - -- source array's place id.
        srcOff - -- starting offset in source matrix
        dst - -- destination vector array
        dstOff - -- starting offset in receiving array at here
        dataCnt - -- count of data to copy

        copy
        

        public static void copy(CompressArray src,
        x10.lang.Int srcOff,
        x10.lang.PlaceLocalHandle<CompressArray> dstplh,
        x10.lang.Int dstpid,
        x10.lang.Int dstOff,
        x10.lang.Int dataCnt)
        

        Copy compress array data from here to the specified remote
place in DistArray.
        

        Parameters:
        src - -- source of compress array at here
        srcOff - -- offset in source
        dstplh - -- target compress array in DistArray
        dstpid - -- place id of target in DistArray.
        dstOff - -- column offset in target
        dataCnt - -- count of data to copy from source

        public final ArrayRemoteCopy x10$matrix$comm$ArrayRemoteCopy$$this$x10$matrix$comm$ArrayRemoteCopy()
        

        Declaration: x10$matrix$comm$ArrayRemoteCopy$$this$x10$matrix$comm$ArrayRemoteCopy(): x10.matrix.comm.ArrayRemoteCopy{self==this(:x10.matrix.comm.ArrayRemoteCopy)}.
        This class supports inter-place communication for data arrays which are defined
in PlaceLocalHandle.


        To enable MPI communication, add "-define MPI_COMMU -cxx-prearg -DMPI_COMMU"
in x10c++ build command, when you include commu package in your application source
code, or link to the proper GML library (native_mpi version).


        For more information on how to build different backends and runtime,
run command "make help" at the root directory of GML library.
